business.headline: Auto stocks drive Sensex, Nifty gains on 2025's first trading dayStock market rally: The S&P BSE Sensex added 368.40 points to end at 78,507.41, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 98.10 points to close at 23,742.90.

WhatsApp Pay's UPI services to cover all Indian users. Check details NPCI's decision allows WhatsApp Pay to serve over 500 million WhatsApp users in the country, a huge leap from earlier restrictions.
Sensex jumps over 600 points: 2 reasons why stock market is rising todayThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 470.08 points to 78,609.09, while the NSE Nifty50 added 138.85 points to 23,783.65 as of 2:20 PM.

Budget 2025: Should Nirmala Sitharaman focus on boosting consumption? India's GDP growth slowed to 5.4% in the second quarter of the current fiscal year, marking an 18-month low. This was primarily due to weak consumption.
Nishant Pitti resigns as Easy Trip Planners CEO after divesting stakeIn a stock exchange filing, Nishant Pitti cited personal reasons for stepping down as the CEO of Easy Trip Planners.

IREDA share price: Multibagger stock jumps 8% today. Here's why IREDA's share price touched an intraday high of Rs 227.65 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), marking a 5.76% increase from its previous close.

Explained: Why SJVN share price rose 8% today SJVN shares were trading at Rs 110.33 as of 11 AM on the National Stock Exchange (NSE). The sharp rise in the stock was accompanied by heavy trading volumes, with over two crore shares changing hands.

Adani Wilmar stocks recover as share price rises 5% in ealry tradeAdani Wilmar share price: The recovery follows a sharp decline of 7% on Tuesday after Adani Enterprises Ltd (AEL) announced its decision to sell its entire 44% stake in Adani Wilmar Ltd (AWL).

Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 2: Check latest subscription, GMPThe IPO is a book-built issue valued at Rs 260.15 crore. It includes a fresh issue of 86 lakh shares, amounting to Rs 184.90 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) of 35 lakh shares, valued at Rs 75.25 crore.
Are BSE, NSE closed on January 1 for New year 2025?In India, the stock markets operate from Monday to Friday and remain closed on weekends, i.e., Saturdays and Sundays.

Stock market today: Sensex, Nifty open flat in first trading session of 2025The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 33.99 points to 78,173.00, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 1.85 points to 23,646.65 as of 9:31 AM.
What is Kekius Maximus? Elon Musk's new identity on XBy adopting the name 'Kekius Maximus' on X, Musk sent the KEKIUS memecoin soaring 500%, sparking renewed interest in the crypto market.
Sensex, Nifty end marginally lower in last trading session of 2024The S&P BSE Sensex fell by 109.12 points to settle at 78,139.01, while the Nifty50 edged down by 0.10 points, closing at 23,644.80.

Sensex and Nifty in 2025: Will Dalal Street's turbulent run continue?Following a volatile 2024 that saw significant gains in the first half before moderating, market experts anticipate single-digit returns in the coming year.

ITR filing deadline extended for belated/revised return. Check all detailsUnion Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary recently revealed in Parliament that only 6.68% of India's population filed ITRs in the fiscal year 2023-24.

Looking to invest in stocks in 2025? 9 picks for your portfolio this New YearThe year 2024 has been decent for Indian stock markets. Both key market indices - the NSE Nifty 50 and the S&P BSE Sensex - went up by 9% during the year.

Explained: Why RITES share price surged 10% todayRITES stock price: The stock opened at Rs 267.15 and soared to an intraday high of Rs 302.80, supported by increased investor interest and heightened trading activity.

Income Tax extends Vivad Se Vishwas deadline to January 31. Key penalty detailsThe Income Tax Department has extended the Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme deadline to January 31, 2025, offering taxpayers a chance to settle disputes at reduced rates.

Dam Capital share price rebounds after Monday's slump. Here's whyDam Capital stock price:  By 11 am, the shares were trading 3.60% higher at Rs 385.70, recovering some ground lost during Monday's profit booking.

ITI share price hits record high as positive rally continuesITI share price: The recent rally has propelled ITI Ltd. above its 5-day, 20-day, 50-day, 100-day, and 200-day moving averages, underlining its robust performance across short- and long-term benchmarks.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: 10 killed after truck rams crowd in US's New Orleans, suspect killedA vehicle crashed into a crowd at the intersection of Bourbon Street and Iberville in New Orleans city and the driver exited the vehicle and started firing at people. The accused driver, Shamsud Din Jabbar, 42, was killed during a shootout with police.

'Wife's family dared him to die by suicide': Big claim by bakery owner's sisterThe family of Puneet Khurana, a Delhi-based bakery owner, who died by suicide, alleged that his estranged wife mentally tortured him and repeatedly demanded her share of their bakery business.

12 killed in Gaza as Israel intensifies attacks to stop Hamas from regroupingWith the war in Gaza now over a year, Israel is focusing its operations in the north and centre of the enclave in what it says is a campaign to stop Hamas militants from waging attacks and regrouping.

Rajasthan girl pulled out 10 days after falling into borewell, declared deadAfter 10 days of searching, three-year-old Chetna's body was found in Kotputli. She was declared dead at the hospital. A post-mortem is underway as authorities continue investigating the incident.

PM Modi meets Diljit Dosanjh, heaps praise on him in 'memorable interaction'Diljit, who recently concluded his months-long pan-India Dil-Luminati tour, took to his Instagram page and posted the glimpse of his meeting with the Prime Minister.

IND vs AUS, Sydney Weather Report: Rain set to affect New Year's TestIndia are set to play their final Test match of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Trophy in Sydney. India will need to win the final Test match to remain in the hunt for the World Test Championship Final. The Sydney weather might make life tricky for Indian players and fans.

1 dead after Tesla truck catches fire, explodes outside Trump's Las Vegas hotelAt least one person died, and seven others were injured after a Tesla Cybertruck caught fire and exploded outside President-elect Donald Trump's hotel, the Las Vegas Metropolitan Police said.

London-bound flight makes emergency landing after teen tries to open door midairA chaotic EasyJet flight from Turkey to London saw a 16-year-old attempt to open an emergency door mid-air, forcing an emergency landing in Italy and leaving passengers traumatised.

Gunshots, panic, bodies lying around: Moments after deadly New Orleans attackAt least 10 people were killed and over 30 injured after a vehicle ploughed into a crowd of people in central New Orleans on Wednesday morning.
Gautam Adani: Trial by fireThe Adani Group chairman retains his business resilience in the face of accusations of bribery and concealment of information, and the attendant political backlash

Nagpur man kills parents over being asked to switch college after failing examsA 25-year-old man was arrested in Nagpur for allegedly killing his parents over academic pressure and being asked to transfer to another college.

Delhi sees 'cold day' for third consecutive day, big dip in maximum temperatureDelhi continued to shiver in cold day conditions for a third consecutive day as the maximum temperature was recorded at 15 degrees Celsius, which is 4.3 degrees below the normal range.

Deva poster: Shahid Kapoor's look from Rosshan Andrrews' film wows fansZee Studios and Roy Kapur Films have released the first poster of Deva, starring Shahid Kapoor and directed by Rosshan Andrrews. The film is slated for a January 31, 2025 release, with the poster stirring excitement among fans.

Centre suggests places for Manmohan Singh's memorial, options sent to his familyThe central government has begun the process of building a memorial for former PM Dr Manmohan Singh, with his family asked to choose from proposed sites near Rajghat, Rashtriya Smriti Sthal, or Kisan Ghat.

Driver tried to 'run over as many as possible', then fired: All about US attackAt least 10 people were killed and over 35 injured when a truck intentionally drove into a large crowd on Canal and Bourbon Street in New Orleans on New Year's Eve.

Video: PM Modi adds beats as Diljit Dosanjh sings devotional songPrime Minister Narendra Modi met Punjabi singer and actor Diljit Dosanjh in New Delhi on Wednesday. During his interaction with the Prime Minister, Dosanjh sang a devotional song, Dhiaan Dhar Mehsoos Kar, and PM Modi added beats to the song by tapping on the table in front of them.

Man jumps into well after domestic dispute, 4 follow to rescue him, all deadThe incident took place at Charhi when Sundar Karmali (27) jumped into a well after a domestic dispute with his wife, Rupa Devi, the official added.

Mumbai's popular local train station welcomes 2025 with horn blowing ceremonyMumbai local trains welcomed the New Year by blowing their horn simultaneously as the clock struck 12 am. Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw shared a video of it on X and wrote, "Happy New Year to everyone."

2024 warmest year in India since 1901, surpassed 2016's record: Weather bodyThe year 2024 now ranks as the warmest year on record since 1901, surpassing 2016, which had recorded a mean land surface air temperature 0.54 degrees Celsius above normal.

Indian dressing room leaks from Australia leave ex-cricketers shockedFormer cricketers, including Irfan Pathan, have condemned the leaks from the Indian dressing room during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, following a news report about Gautam Gambhir's stern address to the team after their Boxing Day Test defeat. The controversy has added to the mounting pressure on the Indian team, which trails 1-2 in the series.

7/G Rainbow Colony 2: Selvaraghavan shares first look of the much-awaited sequelThe first look of the highly anticipated sequel to the classic 7/G Rainbow Colony has been released. Directed by Selvaraghavan, the film features Ravi Krishna reprising his iconic role, with Anaswara Rajan joining the cast. Produced by Sri Surya Movies and AM Rathnam, 7/G Rainbow Colony 2 promises to take audiences on an emotional journey.

sports.headline: Real Madrid eyeing Trent Arnold free transfer from Liverpool: ReportsLiverpool rejected Real Madrid's January bid for Trent Alexander-Arnold, emphasizing their intent to retain the defender despite his expiring contract. I am a massive fan of Jasprit Bumrah, says legendary Glenn McGrathSpeaking to the press on New Year's Day in Sydney, legendary Glenn McGrath said he is a fan of Jasprit Bumrah. The former Australian fast bowler praised Bumrah for his ability to evolve and outsmart batters.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.
